comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I have found an entire article ad posted it to my account: www.flickr.com/photos/richard_arthur_norton/3121129473/ B. H. Andersen was the former general secretary of the board of trade of Butler, Pennsylvania. He left Portland, Maine on March 4, 1931 toward Portland, Oregon leading a donkey. Sources: New Castle News - September 5, 1913, New Castle, Pennsylva... "... As a result of his folly Anderson started Portland Maine on inauguration ... yesterday to walk the entire distance to Portland Oregon Which he agreed to ..." Oakland Tribune - March 4, 1913, Oakland, California "... Donkey on Long Hike Portland, Maine marching a donkey and intending to walk from Portland Maine to Portland Oregon. B H Andersen former general secretary ... "
